noun.description: Discontent; dissatisfaction or annoyance; an instance of this.

adjective.description: Not content; discontented, dissatisfied; ill-pleased. In early use frequently with of, with.

origin: Late 16th century; earliest use found in Thomas Hughes (fl. 1571–1623), lawyer and playwright. From mis- + content. Compare earlier miscontent, miscontent<br>early 16th century; earliest use found in William Horman (1457–1535), schoolmaster and grammarian. From mis- + content. Compare Middle French mescontent; also Italian † miscontento. Compare earlier miscontent and miscontenting.
